answers.body:
Static methods only have access to static objects/variables directly. In order to use any instance you will need to supply it as a parameter.

Because you're accessing an Instance of a database you should leave your code as is. See this answer for a precise difference between Static methods and Instance methods.

Also, you don't need to call gson#toJson if you're using ctx#json, since the latter already does the JSON parsing for you. If you want to use gson you can define it as the default mapper (available since version 5.3.1):

Javalin app = Javalin.create(javalinConfig -> {
    javalinConfig.staticFiles.add("/public");
    javalinConfig.jsonMapper(new JavalinGson());
}).start();

package me.zamin.zsb;

import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.Comparator;
import org.bukkit.Bukkit;
import org.bukkit.ChatColor;
import org.bukkit.command.Command;
import org.bukkit.command.CommandSender;
import org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor;
import org.bukkit.entity.Player;
import org.bukkit.event.EventHandler;
import org.bukkit.event.Listener;
import org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerJoinEvent;
import org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin;
import org.bukkit.scoreboard.*;
import org.bukkit.scoreboard.Scoreboard;

import java.util.*;

public class ZaminScoreBoard extends JavaPlugin implements Listener, TabExecutor {

    private Scoreboard scoreboard;
    private Objective objective;
    private Map<Integer, String> scoreboardLines;

    @Override
    public void onEnable() {
        // Register events and initialize variables
        Bukkit.getPluginManager().registerEvents(this, this);
        scoreboardLines = new HashMap<>();

        // Create the scoreboard and objective
        objective = scoreboard.registerNewObjective("zsb_objective", "dummy");
        objective.setDisplayName(ChatColor.GREEN + "ZaminScoreBoard");

        // Register the commands
        getCommand("zsb").setExecutor(this);
        getCommand("zsb").setTabCompleter(this);
    }

    @Override
    public void onDisable() {
        // Unregister the objective to prevent memory leaks
        objective.unregister();
    }

    @Override
    public boolean onCommand(CommandSender sender, Command command, String label, String[] args) {
        if (args.length >= 1) {
            String subCommand = args[0];

            if (subCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("setdisplay")) {
                if (args.length >= 2) {
                    String displayName = ChatColor.translateAlternateColorCodes('&', args[1]);
                    setScoreboardDisplayName(displayName);
                    sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.GREEN + "Set scoreboard display name to: " + displayName);
                    return true;
                } else {
                    sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "Usage: /zsb setdisplay <displayname>");
                    return true;
                }
            } else if (subCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("addline")) {
                if (args.length >= 2) {
                    String line = ChatColor.translateAlternateColorCodes('&', args[1]);
                    addScoreboardLine(line);
                    sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.GREEN + "Added line to scoreboard: " + line);
                    return true;
                } else {
                    sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "Usage: /zsb addline <line>");
                    return true;
                }
            } else if (subCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("removeline")) {
                if (args.length >= 2) {
                    int lineIndex;
                    try {
                        lineIndex = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                    } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                        sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "Invalid line index.");
                        return true;
                    }

                    removeScoreboardLine(lineIndex);
                    sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.GREEN + "Removed line from scoreboard: " + lineIndex);
                    return true;
                } else {
                    sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "Usage: /zsb removeline <lineindex>");
                    return true;
                }
            } else if (subCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("setline")) {
                if (args.length >= 3) {
                    int lineIndex;
                    try {
                        lineIndex = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                    } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                        sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "Invalid line index.");
                        return true;
                    }

                    String line = ChatColor.translateAlternateColorCodes('&', args[2]);
                    setScoreboardLine(lineIndex, line);
                    sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.GREEN + "Set line " + lineIndex + " to: " + line);
                    return true;
                } else {
                    sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "Usage: /zsb setline <lineindex> <content>");
                    return true;
                }
            }
        }

        sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "ZaminScoreBoard Commands:");
        sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "/zsb setdisplay <displayname> - Set the scoreboard display name.");
        sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "/zsb addline <line> - Add a line to the scoreboard.");
        sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "/zsb removeline <lineindex> - Remove a line from the scoreboard.");
        sender.sendMessage(ChatColor.RED + "/zsb setline <lineindex> <content> - Set the content of a line on the scoreboard.");
        return true;
    }

    @EventHandler
    private void updateScoreboard(Player player) {
        Scoreboard scoreboard = player.getScoreboard();
        Objective objective = scoreboard.getObjective("zsb_objective");

        if (objective == null) {
            objective = scoreboard.registerNewObjective("zsb_objective", "dummy", "ZaminScoreBoard");
            objective.setDisplaySlot(DisplaySlot.SIDEBAR);
        }

        List<String> lines = getConfig().getStringList("scoreboard.lines");
        int lineNumber = lines.size();

        for (String line : lines) {
            String formattedLine = ChatColor.translateAlternateColorCodes('&', line);
            Score score = objective.getScore(formattedLine);
            score.setScore(lineNumber);
            lineNumber--;
        }
    }


        // Sort the scoreboard lines by index
        List<Integer> sortedIndexes = new ArrayList<>(scoreboardLines.keySet());
        sortedIndexes.sort(Comparator.comparingInt(o -> lines.get(o).length()));





    // Add the lines to the scoreboard in descending order
        int score = sortedIndexes.size();
        for (Integer index : sortedIndexes) {
            String line = scoreboardLines.get(index);
            String formattedLine = ChatColor.translateAlternateColorCodes('&', line);

            Scoreboard scoreboard = objective.getScoreboard();
            ScoreboardLine scoreboardLine = new ScoreboardLine(scoreboard, formattedLine);
            scoreboardLine.setScore(score);

            score--;
        }
    }
}

answers.body:
ok I solved it thanks to chatgpt lol.

Here's what I did:

  1. i removed ".exe" off the file extension
  2. after I was getting the ' "chromedriver" cannot be opened because the developer cannot be verified' popup, I did this (copied from chatgpt):
  • Open the "System Preferences" on your macOS.
  • Click on "Security & Privacy."
  • In the "General" tab, you should see a message saying "chromedriver" was blocked from use because it is not from an identified developer.
  • Click on the "Allow Anyway" button next to the message. You might be prompted to enter your username and password to authorize the change. Provide the required information.
  • Try running your code again, and it should now be able to execute the Chromedriver without the verification error.

        System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver", "/Users/sName/eclipse-workspace/libs/chromedriver.exe");
        
        driver.manage().window().maximize();
        driver.manage().deleteAllCookies();
        driver.get(url);
    }
    
    public void mouseHover() {
        driver.findElement(By.xpath("//button[@class='_2KpZ6l _2doB4z']")).click();
        
        WebDriverWait wait1 = new WebDriverWait(driver, Duration.ofSeconds(10));
        wait1.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOfElementLocated(By.xpath("//div[text()='Electronics']")));
        
        WebElement electronicsLink = driver.findElement(By.xpath("//div[text()='Electronics']"));
        
        Actions action = new Actions(driver);
        action.moveToElement(electronicsLink).build().perform();
        
        WaitUtility.waitTillElementVisible(driver, By.xpath("//a[text()='Powerbank']"), Duration.ofSeconds(10));
        WebElement powerbankLink = driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[text()='Powerbank']"));
        action.moveToElement(powerbankLink).click().build().perform();
    }
    
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        flipKart fp = new flipKart();
        fp.invokeBrowser();
        fp.mouseHover();
    }
}

WaitUtility.java file:

package utils;


import java.time.Duration;

import org.openqa.selenium.By;
import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;
import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.WebDriverWait;

public class WaitUtility {
    public static void waitTillElementVisible(WebDriver driver, By by, Duration timeoutInSeconds) {
        WebDriverWait wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, timeoutInSeconds);
        
        wait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOfElementLocated(by));
    }
}
